112211111.content:
Psalms 34:1

I will bless the LORD at all times: HIS PRAISE shall continually be in my mouth.

Can you imagine what our lives would be like if we truly did this. Awesome!

This isn't the verse that I intended to put here. I was going to put verse 6:

This poor man cried, and the LORD heard him and saved himout of all his troubles.

But, when I picked up my Bible and turned to that Psalm . . . well, for a moment I just wanted to put the entire Psalm here. I couldn't choose just one verse. In fact, that is what I started to do but I was so moved with awe as I contemplated the first verse . . . well, what I have written here is the result.

GOD is so good!

I like this idea for an interactive. I may just do something similar in my port.

GOD bless you jarrett!!
112211111.title: Psalms

112211112.content:
One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and said to me, "Come, I will show you the punishment of the great prostitute, who sits on many waters. With her the kings of the earth committed adultery and the inhabitants of the earth were intoxicated with the wine of her adulteries."
Then the angel carried me away in the Spirit into a desert. There I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast that was covered with blasphemous names and had seven heads and ten horns. The woman was dressed in purple and scarlet, and was glittering with gold, precious stones and pearls. She held a golden cup in her hand, filled with abominable things and the filth of her adulteries. This title was written on her forehead:
MYSTERY
BABYLON THE GREAT
THE MOTHER OF PROSTITUTES
AND OF THE ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH. I saw that the woman was drunk with the blood of the saints, the blood of those who bore testimony to Jesus.

When I saw her, I was greatly astonished. Then the angel said to me: "Why are you astonished? I will explain to you the mystery of the woman and of the beast she rides, which has the seven heads and ten horns. The beast, which you saw, once was, now is not, and will come up out of the Abyss and go to his destruction. The inhabitants of the earth whose names have not been written in the book of life from the creation of the world will be astonished when they see the beast, because he once was, now is not, and yet will come.

"This calls for a mind with wisdom. The seven heads are seven hills on which the woman sits. They are also seven kings. Five have fallen, one is, the other has not yet come; but when he does come, he must remain for a little while. The beast who once was, and now is not, is an eighth king. He belongs to the seven and is going to his destruction.

"The ten horns you saw are ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom, but who for one hour will receive authority as kings along with the beast. They have one purpose and will give their power and authority to the beast. They will make war against the Lamb, but the Lamb will overcome them because he is Lord of lords and King of kings—and with him will be his called, chosen and faithful followers."

Then the angel said to me, "The waters you saw, where the prostitute sits, are peoples, multitudes, nations and languages. The beast and the ten horns you saw will hate the prostitute. They will bring her to ruin and leave her naked; they will eat her flesh and burn her with fire. For God has put it into their hearts to accomplish his purpose by agreeing to give the beast their power to rule, until God's words are fulfilled. The woman you saw is the great city that rules over the kings of the earth."
112211112.title: Revelation 17

1431122212.content:
Romans 13
Let everyone be subject to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except that which God has established. The authorities that exist have been established by God. Consequently, whoever rebels against the authority is rebelling against what God has instituted, and those who do so will bring judgment on themselves. For rulers hold no terror for those who do right, but for those who do wrong. Do you want to be free from fear of the one in authority? Then do what is right and you will be commended. 4 For the one in authority is God’s servant for your good. But if you do wrong, be afraid, for rulers do not bear the sword for no reason. They are God’s servants, agents of wrath to bring punishment on the wrongdoer. Therefore, it is necessary to submit to the authorities, not only because of possible punishment but also as a matter of conscience.

6 This is also why you pay taxes, for the authorities are God’s servants, who give their full time to governing. Give to everyone what you owe them: If you owe taxes, pay taxes; if revenue, then revenue; if respect, then respect; if honor, then honor.

Others

1512.content:
Continue
The book of Acts chapter 9:17-19. (Saul's conversion)
New century version. "So Anias went to the house of Judas. He laid his hands on Saul and said, 'Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus sent me. He is the one you saw on the road on your way here. He sent me so that you can see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.' Immediately, something that looked like fish scales fell from Saul's eyes, and he was able to see again! Then Saul got up and was baptized. After he ate some food, his strength was returned"

Amplified Bible. So Annaias left and went into the house. And he laid his hands on Saul and said, "Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, Who appeared to you along the way by which you came here, has sent me that you may recover your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit." And instantly something like scales fell from Saul's eyes, and he recovered his sight. Then he arose and was baptized. And after he took some food, he was strengthened. For several days afterward he remained with the disciples at Damascus.

What happens next?
1512.title: The Acts

15433.content:
Genesis 1:1
In the Beginning, God created the Heavens and the Earth.

Genesis 1:2
And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was on the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved on the face of the waters.

Now...let me get this straight; God attempted to create something that was formless and void. Formless and Void means that something does not have shape. (No physical form.) If something has no physical form, it doesn't exist. So essentially, in the very first two lines of the Bible, God tried to create Nothing...

HOWEVER, by trying to create nothing, he ACCIDENTALLY created something. If the earth was formless and void, then how did a body of water, with a definitive face and surface appear?
A body of water is NOT formless and void; it DOES have form. Water is not nothing, as the writers of the bible tried to depict.

I'm sorry but, this is the FIRST Two lines of a supposedly Infallible Sacred Text, and we've already got one of the hundreds of contradictions that supposedly "don't exist."
15433.title: Genesis 1:1 - 1:2

154331.content:
- point of interest, this is one of those verses where Jesus speaking; keep that in mind -

Do not think that I came to bring peace on the eart;
I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.
For I came to SET A MAN AGAINST HIS FATHER.
AND A DAUGHTER AGAINST HER MOTHER.
AND A DAUGHTER-IN-LAW AGAINST HER MOTHER-IN-LAW;
and A MAN'S ENEMIES WILL BE THE MEMBERS OF HIS HOUSEHOLD.
He who loves father or mother more than Me is not worthy of Me;
and he who loves son or daughter more than Me is not worthy of Me.


...Is it just me, or does Jesus sound rather full of himself?
I mean, actually suggesting that if someone loves their children more than him, is something wrong...it's rather sick.
Seems rather contradictory for the guy who is supposedly all about "Peace and Love"; especially when in tandem with the Fifth Commandment...
Also...rather than Peace and Love, Jesus seems to want to inspire conflict.
154331.title: Matthew 10:34-38

1543311.content:
Luke 14:26 - another straight from Jesus' mouth.
Whoever comes to me and does not hate his father, and his mother, and his brothers, and his sisters, and his wife, and his children, and even his own life...he cannot be my disciple.

...Wow...Where do I begin?
So, apparently you can't follow in Jesus' path, unless you completely turn against your family and loved once, and live a potentially suicidal life of self-loathing?
Makes sense; those who hit rock-bottom are usually desperate enough for Religion. But this verse seems to be trying to INSPIRE someone to hit rock bottom.
And much like I said last time, not only demanding that someone love you more than their own family/wife/and children, but demanding that person HATE them before they love you...that is just sick.
Seems to contradict everything you once assumed about the man called Jesus, doesn't it?

Speaking of contradictions...
1543311.title: Luke 14:26

15433111.content:
1 John 3:15
Everyone who hates his brother is a murderer; and you know that no murderer has eternal life abiding in him.

You remember that LAST verse that I criticized? It basically said that if you don't hate everyone in your family, Jesus doesn't want you. He WANTS you to hate your brothers...And yet, when you do, Christ pulls the rug out from under you and says, "If you hate your brother, you're a MURDERER!!!"
My older brother hates me and our sisters, and our parents...Are any of us Dead? Did he murder us JUST through his hatred alone? Cause if he did, then I'm amazed I can be typing this from beyond the grave.

And considering that there's no "Eternal Life" abiding within "Murderers", that basically means you're going to go to Hell...specifically for what Jesus told you to do. (Don't believe me, Join me for my NEXT favorite verse - Revelations 21:8)

Also, if there's no Eternal Life Abiding in Murderers...then why does the Bible depict God still being alive? - considering by sheer body-count alone, he's the greatest mass murderer who ever "existed".
15433111.title: 1 John 3:15

choices: Let's all go to the Exodus
154331111.content:
Revelations 21:8
But for the cowardly and unbelieving and abominable and MURDERERS and immoral persons and sorcerers and idolaters and all liars, their part WILL BE in the lake that burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death."

So, let me get this straight; God Told you to Honor Thy Mother and Thy Father back in Exodus, but Jesus - who many people believe was an Avatar of God, in the whole Trinity thing (even though the Bible makes NO reference to such a Trinity) - seems to disagree with him.
Jesus told you to Love your Neighbor as yourself...But he also wants you to Hate Yourself, and the Members of your Family. In fact, if you don't hate your family, you can't follow in his path. However, if you DO hate your family, you're a Murderer, and you're going to go to Hell, regardless of what Jesus said earlier...

...I'm starting to think this game is rigged.
But don't worry; if this seems like one of HUNDREDS of nonsensical contradictions found throughout the Bible, both Old and New Testament. Just remember what your Preacher told you -

"The Bible doesn't contradict itself. So this is not a Contradiction; this is..................NOT a contradiction."

And to those who might say, "You're misunderstanding this because you're taking it out of context."
Is it REALLY out of context? Or could it be from the fact that a majority of the books in the Bible were written by different people, several decades apart, with practically no communication or cooperation?

Moving beyond that obvious tripe, let's look at who else is burning...Particularly Sorcerers. I hope that everyone who reads this can understand the very simple fact that Magic and Sorcery do NOT exist...In fact, a majority of Christians I know in real life, will adamantly protest that Magic does NOT exist...And yet, they still feel threatened by Harry Potter. Because apparently Magic and Witchcraft are two different things...But despite their disbelief in Magic, they also adamantly defen that everything that God does...is NOT magic. Because conjuring something into existence through a speaking-spell and turning water to wine is REAL...and Magic is NOT...
...Right?

I find it kind of funny that "All Liars" is mentioned...I hope Ray Comfort has read this part...even though I know he hasn't.
154331111.title: Revelations 21:8

info.brief_description: i can do all things through christ whom strengthens me
